TASK.TITLE: Adjustment of the Door Locking Mechanism Door M4L/M4R

WARNING.PARA: BEFORE YOU START WORK, YOU MUST PUT ON A SAFETY HARNESS AND ATTACH IT TO THE ACCESS PLATFORM. WITHOUT A SAFETY HARNESS, YOU CAN FALL. THIS CAN KILL YOU OR CAUSE YOU INJURY.
BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS/CLEANING AGENTS, SEALANTS AND OTHER MATERIALS.
OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS AND THE LOCAL REGULATIONS.
MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS A GOOD FLOW OF AIR THROUGH THE WORK AREA.
DO NOT BREATHE THE FUMES.
DO NOT SMOKE.
DO NOT USE THESE MATERIALS NEAR A FLAME, SPARKS OR SOURCES OF HEAT.
USE PROTECTIVE CLOTHING, GOGGLES AND GLOVES.
IF YOU GET ONE OF THESE MATERIALS:

UNLITEM.PARA: ON YOUR SKIN OR IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH IT AWAY WITH A FLOW OF CLEAN WATER.
IN YOUR MOUTH, GET IMMEDIATE MEDICAL AID.

WARNING.PARA: IN GENERAL, THESE MATERIALS ARE FLAMMABLE, POISONOUS AND SKIN IRRITANTS.

NOTE.PARA: Do this adjustment procedure only after maintenance when replacement of components or a malfunction of a door locking mechanism occurred.

ENTRY.PARA: Electrical Bonding of Components with Conductive Screws and Bolts and Bonding Straps

L1ITEM.PARA: Aircraft Maintenance Configuration

L2ITEM.PARA: Energize the aircraft electrical circuits
Put an ACCESS PLATFORM 5M (16 FT)- ADJUSTABLE in position.
Open the passenger crew door 52-10-00-010-80152-10-00-010-801-A.
Do the special precaution before you work on the door 52-10-00-860-80152-10-00-860-801-A.
Make sure that the door is in the correct installation position of the fuselage 52-10-00-820-80352-10-00-820-803-A.
On the OMS Home page, select Power Distribution Control or C/B Management

L1ITEM.PARA: Open, safety/lock and tag this(these) circuit breaker(s):
Get Access

L2ITEM.PARA: If necessary, remove the thermal and acoustical insulation 25-80-00-910-80225-80-00-910-802-A.
Install the support frame 98L52108459000FRAME-SUPPORT,BALLAST WEIGHT
Install the ballast weight 98L52108517000WEIGHT - BALANCE, MAIN DECK DOOR 4 AND 5.
For the adjustment of the door locking mechanism use the tool set 98L52108695000TOOL SET-ADJUSTMENT,MAIN DECK DOOR 4.

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Inner Door-Operation Handle

PARA.GRPHCREF: Adjustment of the Inner Door Operation Handle

L2ITEM.PARA: Close the door and make sure that the inner door-operation handle is in the fully lowered position.
Remove the nut (27), the bolt (30), the washers (28, 29) and the target bracket (26).
Put the adjustment gage (16) in position:
On the bracket (3) make sure that the lever (2) touches the stop bolt (10). If the lever (2) does not touch the stop bolt (10), adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the tension from the torsion spring. To do this, do the procedure in paragraph C.(3)(a) and (b).
Remove and discard the cotter pin (20), the nut (21), the washers (22, 23) and the bolt (24) from the rod (17) and the lever (25).
Lower the door-operation handle (1) and remove the nut (15), the washer (14), the stop bolt (10) and the washers (11, 12, 13).
Add or remove the washers (11, 12, 13) until the lever (2) is in contact with the stop bolt (10).
Install the washer (14) and the nut (15).

L2ITEM.PARA: Lift the door-operation handle (1) and make sure that the roller of the lever (2) touches the stop bolt (9). If the roller of the lever (2) does not touch the stop bolt (9), adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Lower the inner door operation handle (1) and remove the nut (4), the washer (5), the stop bolt (9) and the washers (8, 5, 7).
Add or remove the washers (8, 5, 7) until the roller of the lever (2) is in contact with the stop bolt (9).
Install the washer (5) and the nut (4).
Do the check of the overcenter position as described in paragraph H. (3) (a) thru (b).

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the adjustment gage.
Put the target bracket (26) in position and install the washers (28, 29), the bolt (30) and the nut (27).

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L2ITEM.PARA: Put the rod (17) in position on the lever (25) and install the washers (22, 23), the bolt (24) and the nut (21). Make sure that you can install the bolt (24) easily. If you cannot install the bolt (24) easily, remove the lockwire (18), loosen the nut (19) and adjust the length of the rod (17).
Safety the nut (21) with new 52132106-230cotter pin20.

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L2ITEM.PARA: Safety the nut (19) with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*).
Adjust the target on the target bracket (26) 52-71-11-820-80652-71-11-820-806-A.

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Outer Door-Operation Handle

PARA.GRPHCREF: Adjustment of the Outer Door Operation Handle

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the vertical clearance between the outer door operation handle (10) and the door fuselage skin is 1.5 mm (0.059 in.) to 2.5 mm (0.098 in.). If the vertical clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the bolt (1), the tabwasher (2) and the washers (3, 4, 5).
Remove the nuts (7) the bolts (9), the washers (8), the bearing flange (6) and the washers (4, 5). To adjust the vertical clearance add or remove the washers (4, 5).

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the remaining sealant from the bearing flange (6) and the structure. Use a SCRAPER - NON METALLIC:

WARNING.PARA: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE MATERIAL No. 11-026.
OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS.

L3ITEM.PARA: Clean the contact area of the bearing flange (6) and the structure with CLEANING AGENTS (11026*).

WARNING.PARA: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE MATERIAL No. 09-013.
OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS.

L3ITEM.PARA: Apply a layer of SEALANTS (09013*) to the mating surface of the bearing flange (6).

L2ITEM.PARA: Put the bearing flange (6) in position and install the washers (8), the bolts (9) and the nuts (7).
Install the washers (4, 5), the washer (3), the new tab washer (2) and the bolt (1).
Safety the bolt (1) with the tab washer (2).
Make sure that the offset between the outer door-operation handle (10) and the door skin is +0.75 mm (0.029 in.) to -0.75 mm (-0.029 in.). If the offset is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Loosen the screw (26) and adjust the offset with the stop (25). Tighten the screw (26).

L2ITEM.PARA: On the upper part of the outer door-operation handle (19), push and pull to make sure that the outer door-operation handle (10) does not shake. If the outer door-operation handle shakes, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the cap (11).

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the lockwire (13) and loosen the nut (12, 14).
Turn the adjustment nut (12, 14) until the shake is removed.
Safety the nut (12, 14) with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (13).

L2ITEM.PARA: Fully lift the outer door control handle and make sure that the clearance between the lock (15) and the roller (20) is between 0.2 mm (0.008 in.) and 0.5 mm (0.020 in.). If the clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the bolt (16) and the washers (17). Add or remove the washers (17) and install the bolt (16) until the clearance is correct.

L2ITEM.PARA: Pull and push the outer door control handle (10) to check that the clearance between the stop fitting (24) and the roller (18) is between 0.3 mm (0.012 in.) and 0.5 mm (0.020 in.).
If the clearance between the stop fitting (24) and the roller (18) is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Lift the outer door control handle to fully open.
Remove the screws (23), the washers (22), the stop fitting (24) and the washers (21). To adjust the vertical clearance, add or remove the washers (21).

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the old sealant from the stop fitting (24) and the structure. Use a SCRAPER - NON METALLIC:

WARNING.PARA: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE MATERIAL No. 11-026.
OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS.

L3ITEM.PARA: Clean the mating surface of the stop fitting (24) and the structure with CLEANING AGENTS (11026*).

WARNING.PARA: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE MATERIAL No. 09-013.
OBEY THE MATERIAL MANUFACTURER'S INSTRUCTIONS.

L3ITEM.PARA: Apply a layer of SEALANTS (09013*) to the contact area of the stop fitting (24).
Install the washers (21), the stop fitting (24), the washers (22) and the screws (23).

L2ITEM.PARA: Lower the outer door-control handle and push the safety flap (19) against the stop (28).
Make sure that the clearance between the safety flap (19) and the handle structure is a maximum of 16.5 mm (0.650 in.):

L3ITEM.PARA: If the clearance is not correct, remove the screws (27), the stop (28) and the washers (29). To adjust the clearance, add or remove the washers (29).
Install the washers (29), the stop (28) and the screws (27).

L2ITEM.PARA: Lift and lower the outer door-control handle (10) and make sure that the safety flap (19) resets and is flush with the handle structure.
Install the cap (11).

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Drive Shaft and the Latch/Lift Shaft

NOTE.PARA: The adjustment of one side of the drive shaft and the latch/lift shaft is described, the adjustment of the other side is the same.

L2ITEM.PARA: Install the rigging pin (7) diameter 5.8 mm (0.228 in.) in the lever (3) and (4) of the drive shaft (2) and the latch/lift shaft (1).
Remove the cotter pins (27), the nuts (26), the washers (24, 25), the bolts (23) and the rod (19). Discard the cotter pins (27).
Remove the tension from the torsion spring:

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove and discard the lockwire (30) from the nut (32).
Loosen the nut (32) and turn the nut (31) counterclockwise to decrease the pretension.

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the cotter pins (27), the nuts (26), the washers (24, 25), the bolts (23) and the rod (41). Discard the cotter pins (27).
Remove the cotter pin (27), the nut (26), the bolt (23), the washers (24, 25) and loosen the rod (47) from the drive shaft (2). Discard the cotter pin (27).
Make sure that the clearance between the lever (3) and (5) is 0.9 mm (0.035 in.) to 1.7 mm (0.067 in.). If the clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the nut (11), the washer (10), the stop bolt (12) and the washers (9).
To adjust the clearance, add or remove the washers (9).
Install the washers (9), the stop bolt (12), the washer (10) and the nut (11). Make sure that the stop bolt (12) touches the stop (8).

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the rigging pin (7).
Make sure that the clearance between the lever (3) and the lever (5) is 1.5 mm (0.059 in.) to 1.9 mm (0.075 in.). If the clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the nut (16), the washer, (15), the stop bolt (13) and the washers (14).
To adjust the clearance, add or remove the washers (14).
Install the washers (14), the stop bolt (13), the washer (15) and the nut (16). Make sure that the stop bolt (13) touches the lever (3).

L2ITEM.PARA: Check the overcenter position of the lever (5). To do this task, do these steps:

L3ITEM.PARA: Put the adjustment gage (28) in position and install the rigging pin (50).

Make sure that the adjustment gage (28) is in contact with the lever (5), then install the rigging pin (51). If you cannot install the rigging pin (51) easily, adjust the stops (8, 13) as described in paragraph C. (6) thru (8) (c).

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Put the rod (47) in position on the drive shaft (2) and install the washers (24, 25), the bolt (23) and the nut (26). Safety the nut (26) with the new 52132106-230cotter pin27. If necessary, remove the lockwire (49), loosen the nuts (48) and adjust the length of the rod (47):
Tighten the nuts (48) and safety with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (49).
Remove the adjustment gage (28).

Put the rod (19) in position and make sure that you can install the bolts (23) easily. If you cannot install the bolts easily, remove the nut (21), the washer (20), and turn the lug (22) until the length of the rod is correct.
Install the washer (20) and the nut (21).
Put the rod (19) in position and install the washers (24, 25), the bolts (23), the nuts (26) and safety with the new 52132106-230cotter pins27.

L2ITEM.PARA: Check the overcenter position of the lever (38). To do this task, do these steps:

L3ITEM.PARA: Loosen the rod (21) as described in paragraph F. (2) (d) thru (e).
Install the adjustment gage (45):
Make sure that you can install the rigging pins (52, 53) of the adjustment gage (45) easily and the adjustment gage has contact to the shaft (43).

Make sure that the clearance 0.1 mm (0.0039 in.) to 0.4 mm (0.0157 in.) between the stop bolt (37) and the lever (38) is correct. If the clearance is not correct, remove the stop bolt (37), the washers (36) and add or remove the washers (36) until the clearance is correct. Install the washers (36) and the stop bolt (37).
Remove the adjustment gage (45).

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Put the rod (41) in position and make sure that you can install the bolts (23) easily. If you cannot install the bolts easily, remove the lockwire (40) loosen the nuts (39) and adjust the length of the rod (41) until you can install the bolts (23) easily.
Install the washers (24, 25), the bolts (23), and the nuts (26). Safety the nuts (26) with the new 52132106-230cotter pins20.
Make sure that the clearance 1.1 mm (0.043 in.) to 2.1 mm (0.083 in.) between the lever (44) and the lever (42) on the shaft (43) is correct. If the clearance is not correct, adjust the rod (41).
Tighten the nuts (39) and safety with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (40).
Install the rod (21) as described in paragraph F. (2) (h).

L1ITEM.PARA: Pre-adjustment of the Lower and Upper Connection Link

PARA.GRPHCREF: Preadjustment of the Lower and Upper Connection Link

NOTE.PARA: This pre-adjustment procedure is only necessary if you install a new lower or upper connection link or the clearance is not correct.

L2ITEM.PARA: Remove the brackets for the rubber bellows from the door structure 52-13-21-000-80152-13-21-000-801-A.

Close the door and make sure that there is a clearance of 0 mm (0.0000 in.) to 0.05 mm (0.0020 in.) between the door structure and the lower connection link (10). If the clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the bolt (31), the washer (30) and loosen the bonding straps (29, 28).
Remove the tension of the torsion spring as described in para. C.(3).
Remove the cotter pin (14), the nut (15), the washer (16), the bolt (17), the washer (19) and disconnect the rod (18) from the lower connection link (10). Discard the cotter pin (14).
Loosen the tabwasher (34), remove the bolt (35), the washer (33) and the tabwasher (34).
Carefully remove the axle (13), and the washers (11, 20, 21, 22), but do not remove the the connection link (10).

Put the connection link (10) on one side of the frame and measure the clearance between the frame and the connection link (10). To find the middle point, divide the measured clearance by two and then add 0.05 mm (0.0020 in.) to the result on each side.
Prepare two packs of washers (11, 20, 21, 22) of the calculated thickness.
Install the tool (32) between the frames and push the frames 0.1 mm (0.0039 in.) more.
Put the lower connection link (10) in position and install the packs of the washers (11, 20 , 21, 22).
Install the axle (13), the washer (33), the tabwasher (34) and the bolt (35).
Remove the tool (32).
Safety the bolt (35) with the tabwasher (34).
Put the rod (18) in position and install the the washer (19), the bolt (17), the washer (16) and the nut (15).
Safety the nut (15) with the new 52132107-180cotter pin14.
Put the bonding straps (28, 29) in position and install the washer (30) and the bolt (31) 20-28-00-912-80320-28-00-912-803-A.

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the dimension between the lower connection link (10) and the beam 4 is 173.2 mm (6.819 in.) to 175.2 mm (6.898 in.). If the dimension is not correct, adjust as follows:

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the lockwire (24) and loosen the nuts (23).
Turn the rod (18) to get the correct dimension.
Tighten the nuts (23) and safety with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (24).

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that there is a clearance of 0 mm (0.0000 in.) to 0.05 mm (0.0020 in.) between the door structure and the upper connection link (1). If the clearance is not correct, do this adjustment procedure:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the bolt (27), the washer (26) and the bonding strap (25).
Remove the cotter pins (2), the nuts (3) and the washers (4). Discard the cotter pins (2).
Carefully remove the bolts (8), the washers (5, 6), the upper connection link (1) and if necessary the spacers (7). Do not remove the connection link (1) fully.

Put the connection link (1) on one side of the frame and measure the clearance between the frame and the connection link (1). To find the middle point, divide the measured clearance by two and then add 0.15 mm (0.0059 in.) to the result on each side.
Prepare two packs of washers (5, 6) of the calculated thickness.
Install the tool (32) between the frames and push the frames 0.3 mm (0.0118 in.) more.
Put the upper connection link (1) in position and install the washers (5, 6).
If removed, install the spacers (7), the bolts (8), the washers (4) and the nuts (3).
Remove the tool (32).
Safety the nuts (3) with the new 52132107-180cotter pins2.
Put the bonding strap (25) in position and install the washer (28) and the bolt (25) 20-28-00-912-80320-28-00-912-803-A.
Install the access cover and the brackets 52-13-21-400-80152-13-21-400-801-A.

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Anti-Lowering Mechanism

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the dimension 94.1 mm (3.705 in.) to 95.1 mm (3.744 in.) is correct. If the dimension is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Loosen the nuts (8) and adjust the bracket (9) until the dimension is correct. Tighten the nuts (8).

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the dimension 27.3 mm (1.075 in.) to 27.9 mm (1.098 in.) is correct. If the dimension is not correct, adjust as follows:

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the lockwire (6), loosen the nuts (5) and adjust the rod (7) until the dimensions are correct.
Tighten the nuts (5) and safety with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (6).

L2ITEM.PARA: Open the door to a position that is immediately before the guide rollers come out of the guide fittings. Make sure that the dimension between the roller (3) and the stop bolt (2) is 3 mm (0.118 in.) to 3.5 mm (0.138 in.) . If the dimension is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Close the door and remove the stop bolt (2) and the adjustment washers (4).
Install the stop bolt (2) with adjustment washers (4) of the correct thickness.
Fully open the door and check that the roller (3) touches the stop surface of the locking hook (1).

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Vertical Travel

L2ITEM.PARA: Measure the vertical travel:

L3ITEM.PARA: Close the door from the outside.
In the middle of the door measure the lower horizontal clearance.
Lift the door to the fully lifted position, but do not open it. Then measure the horizontal clearance again.
Calculate the difference between the lowered and lifted position of the door.

L2ITEM.PARA: The vertical travel must be 42.9 mm (1.689 in.) to 44.9 mm (1.768 in.). If the vertical travel is not correct adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the screws (17, 19), the washers (18) and the brackets (16, 20).
Remove the latch/lift fittings 52-13-32-000-80152-13-32-000-801-A.

On the lower guide fittings, release the weight of the door. To do this, open the door, insert distance pieces of hard plastic or equivalent material between the guide roller and the lowest point of the guide fitting. Lower the door to release the weight of the door.
Remove and discard the cotter pins (2), remove the nuts (3) and the washers (4).
Carefully move the inner door-operation handle up and down until you can remove the bolts (6) and the washers (5). Loosen the rods (1, 21).
Remove the nut (11), the washer (12, 13) and the bolt (14).
Record the position of the excenter disk (15). Remove the excenter disk (15) and adjust as follows:

UNLITEM.PARA: To increase the vertical travel, turn the excenter disk (15) outwards
To decrease the vertical travel, turn the excenter disk (15) inwards.

L3ITEM.PARA: Put the rods (1, 21) in position and install the washers (5) and the bolts (6). To do this, move the inner door operation handle carefully up and down until you can install the bolts (6) smoothly.
Do this procedure again until the vertical travel is correct.
Install the washers (4) and the nuts (3), safety the nuts (3) with the new 52132107-180cotter pin2and 52132110-380cotter pin2.
Put the washer (13, 12) in position and install the bolt (14) and the nut (11).
Carefully lift the door and remove the distance pieces from the lower guide fittings.
Put the brackets (16, 20) in position and install the washers (18) and the screws (17, 19).
Remove the latch/lift fittings 52-13-32-000-80152-13-32-000-801-A.
Adjust the latch/lift fittings 52-10-00-820-80352-10-00-820-803-A.

L1ITEM.PARA: Pre-adjustment of the Torsion Spring

NOTE.PARA: This pre-adjustment procedure is only necessary if you install a new torsion spring (8).

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the torsion spring (8) is removed.
Put the inner handle (9) to the fully open position and make sure that the roller (10) touches the stop (11).
Make sure that the distance between beam 5 and the lever (7) is 95.1 mm (3.744 in.) to 96.1 mm (3.783 in.). If the distance is not correct adjust as follows:

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the lockwire (2), loosen the nuts (3) and adjust the length of the rod (1) until the dimension is correct. Tighten and safety the nuts (3) with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*)(2).

WARNING.PARA: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU DO WORK WITH THE LOCKSPRINGS. THEY ARE IN TENSION OR COMPRESSION, WHICH CAN BE DANGEROUS.

L2ITEM.PARA: Install the new torsion spring (8) and the locksprings (14). Make sure that the marks on the torsion spring (8), the lever (15) and the torsion pipe (16) is in line.

Put the support bearings (21, 22) in position and attach them with the cable ties (23, 24). Make sure that the clearance between the support bearings (21, 22) and the torsion pipe (25) is 1.5 mm (0.059 in.) to 2.5 mm (0.098 in.).
Adjust the tension of the torsion spring (8) as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Turn the nut (18) clockwise until the door stays in its lifted position.

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the lever (7) touches the stop bolt (4) and the pack of the washers (5) is minimum 12 mm (0.472 in.). If the lever does not touch the stop bolt (4) and the pack of washers does not have the minimum thickness, remove the nut (6) the washer (13) the stop bolt (4) and add or remove the washers (5). Install the washer (13) and the nut (6). Make sure that the roller (10) is in contact with the stop bolt (11).

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L2ITEM.PARA: Tighten and safety the nut (19) with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (20).
Close the door.

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Guide-Arm Cover Mechanism

PARA.GRPHCREF: Adjustment of the Guide-Arm Cover Mechanism

L2ITEM.PARA: Open the door.
Make sure that the clearance is 0.3 mm (0.0118 in.) to 0.9 mm (0.0354 in.) between the roller (5) and the lever (4) is correct. If the clearance is not correct, adjust as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the flight lock actuator 52-71-53-000-80152-71-53-000-801-A.

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L3ITEM.PARA: Remove the lockwire (2) and loosen the nuts (3).
Adjust the length of the rod (1) until the clearance is correct.
Tighten the nuts (3) and safety with LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*) (2).

L2ITEM.PARA: Check the overcenter position of the lever (6). To do this, close the door and continue as follows:

L3ITEM.PARA: Put the adjustment gage (7) in position:

Make sure that the clearance between the lever (6) and adjustment gage (7) is 2 mm (0.079 in.) to 3.5 mm (0.138 in.). If the clearance is not correct, adjust as described in paragraph A. (5) (a) thru (c).
Remove the adjustment gage (7).

L2ITEM.PARA: Install the flight lock actuator 52-71-53-400-80152-71-53-400-801-A.

L1ITEM.PARA: Adjustment of the Guide Arm Cover

L2ITEM.PARA: If necessary, do the adjustment of the guide arm cover:

L3ITEM.PARA: If removed, install the thermal and acoustical insulation 25-80-00-910-80225-80-00-910-802-A.
If necessary, do the adjustment of the horizontal position:

L4ITEM.PARA: Remove the cotter pin (5) and the washers (4).
Remove the pin (1) and carefully move the lever (3) until the guide arm cover is in the correct horizontal position.
Insert the pin (1) through the applicable hole in the cover lever (2) and the lever (3).
Install the washers (4) and the new 52132102-280cotter pin5.

L3ITEM.PARA: If necessary, do the adjustment of the vertical position:

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L4ITEM.PARA: Cut, remove and discard the lockwire from the nuts (7).
Release the locking devices (6) and loosen the nuts (7).
Adjust the bolt (8) until the guide arm cover is in the correct vertical position.
Tighten the nuts (7) and make sure that the vertical position is correct.

WARNING.PARA: USE GOGGLES WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE. EACH TIME YOU CUT LOCKWIRE, REMOVE AND DISCARD IT IMMEDIATELY. LOOSE LOCKWIRE CAN CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DAMAGE.

L4ITEM.PARA: Safety the nuts (7) with the locking devices (6) and LOCKWIRE STAINLESS STEEL ANNEALED 0.8MM DIA (19010*).

L1ITEM.PARA: Do the Functional Test of the Passenger/crew Door M4L/M4R 52-10-00-720-80152-10-00-720-801-A.
Close Access

L2ITEM.PARA: Make sure that the work area is clean and clear of tools and other items.
If not installed, install the thermal and acoustical insulation 25-80-00-910-80225-80-00-910-802-A.
If not installed, install the door lining 25-23-53-400-80125-23-53-400-801-A.
Remove the ballast weight 98L52108517000WEIGHT - BALANCE, MAIN DECK DOOR 4 AND 5 and the support frame 98L52108459000FRAME-SUPPORT,BALLAST WEIGHT.
On the OMS Home page, select Power Distribution Control or C/B Management

L1ITEM.PARA: Remove the tag(s) and/or the SAFETY CLIP-CIRCUIT BREAKER and close/unlock this(these) circuit breaker(s):
Put the aircraft back to its initial configuration.

L2ITEM.PARA: Do the special precaution after work on the door 52-10-00-860-80252-10-00-860-802-A.
Remove the ground support and maintenance equipment, the special and standard tools and all other items.
Close the passenger crew door 52-10-00-410-80152-10-00-410-801-A.
Remove the ACCESS PLATFORM(S).
De-energize the ground service network
